name: Necromancer
description: Evokers who channel the energies of death and undeath, commanding undead minions and wielding life-draining magic to achieve power through the manipulation of mortality itself.

resource_systems.name: Mana
resource_systems.description: Magical energy that powers spellcasting and necromantic abilities
resource_systems.regeneration: 5 per 6 seconds, +8 when draining life force or in areas of death
mechanics: Mana points are spent to cast necromantic spells and control undead
Some undead control spells require maintaining focus, consuming mana over time
Short rests restore a significant portion of maximum mana
Depleted mana causes penalties to undead control and necromantic spell effectiveness
Can be temporarily boosted through sacrificial rituals or life drain
Successful life drain or death of enemies restores a portion of mana

resource_systems.name: Arcane Focus
resource_systems.description: Mental concentration and magical attunement that enhances spellcasting effectiveness
resource_systems.regeneration: Builds when casting necromantic spells successfully, decreases when undead control is lost
mechanics: Increases by 20 when successfully draining life force or controlling powerful undead
Increases by 15 per 10 seconds when maintaining control over multiple undead
Decreases by 20 when undead control is lost or necromantic spells are countered
Decreases by 15 per minute when not actively using necromantic magic
Can be spent to enhance life drain effects or strengthen undead minions
Higher Arcane Focus increases the potency of necromantic spells and undead control

resource_systems.name: Magical Resonance
resource_systems.description: Attunement to death energies that enhances necromantic power
resource_systems.regeneration: Builds when casting death magic or absorbing life force
mechanics: Increases by 15 when successfully draining life or creating undead
Increases by 20 when absorbing death energies from the environment
Decreases by 15 when necromantic spells are resisted or countered
Decreases by 20 when forced to use non-necromantic magic
Can be spent to amplify death magic or strengthen the bond with undead minions
Higher Magical Resonance increases the range and potency of death magic

resource_systems.name: Death Essence
resource_systems.description: Accumulated energy of death and decay that fuels powerful necromantic abilities
resource_systems.regeneration: Builds when causing death, draining life, or in areas of strong death energy
mechanics: Increases by 15 when successfully draining life force from living beings
Increases by 10 when creating or enhancing undead servants
Decreases by 15 when life-affirming magic is used in the vicinity
Decreases by 10 when undead servants are destroyed
Can be spent to perform powerful necromantic rituals or create superior undead
At maximum Death Essence, enter a state of perfect attunement with death energies

class_mechanics.name: Undead Mastery
class_mechanics.description: Ability to create, control, and enhance undead servants
effects: Can create various types of undead servants from corpses
Able to maintain control over multiple undead simultaneously
Can enhance undead with special abilities and greater power
Presence strengthens nearby undead and weakens turning attempts
Can sense undead and death energies in the surrounding area

class_mechanics.name: Life Drain
class_mechanics.description: Ability to drain life force from living beings
effects: Can drain health from enemies to restore own health
Able to transfer drained life force to undead servants to heal them
Can establish persistent drain effects that weaken over time
Presence naturally weakens life force in the surrounding area
Can sense life force and vitality in living beings

class_mechanics.name: Death Magic
class_mechanics.description: Mastery of spells that cause disease, decay, and death
effects: Can cast spells that cause disease and decay in living targets
Able to manipulate the boundary between life and death
Can create zones of death energy that harm living creatures
Presence disrupts healing magic and life-affirming effects
Can predict and sometimes delay the moment of death

class_mechanics.name: Fear Manipulation
class_mechanics.description: Ability to instill and control fear in others
effects: Can cast spells that cause targets to flee in terror
Able to feed on the fear of others to strengthen necromantic abilities
Can create auras of dread that weaken enemy resolve
Presence naturally causes unease and fear in living beings
Can sense fear and use it to track or manipulate targets

signature_abilities.name: Army of the Dead
signature_abilities.description: Raise a temporary army of powerful undead servants to fight for you
mechanics: Summon 5-10 powerful undead servants that last for 10 minutes
Undead types include skeletal warriors, ghouls, wraiths, and a death knight commander
Each undead has special abilities based on its type
Can direct the entire army with simple mental commands
If you are reduced below 25% health, the army will prioritize your protection
Costs 100 Mana, 50 Magical Resonance, and 75 Death Essence

signature_abilities.name: Harvest of Souls
signature_abilities.description: Drain life force from all enemies in range, healing yourself and empowering your magic
mechanics: Create a 20-meter radius field of death energy that lasts for 5 minutes
All enemies within the field suffer continuous life drain
Drained life force heals you and your undead servants
Each successful drain increases your necromantic spell power
Enemies that die within the field have a chance to rise as temporary undead servants
Costs 75 Mana, 100 Arcane Focus, and 50 Death Essence

signature_abilities.name: Lichform
signature_abilities.description: Temporarily transform into a lich, gaining immense necromantic power and undead resilience
mechanics: For 5 minutes, transform into a powerful lich entity
Gain immunity to poison, disease, sleep, stun, and mind-affecting effects
All necromantic spells cost 50% less mana and have increased effectiveness
Can control unlimited numbers of undead within visual range
Presence causes fear in living creatures and weakens their attacks
Costs 50 Mana, 75 Magical Resonance, and 100 Death Essence

skill_trees.name: Path of the Undead Master
skill_trees.focus: Creating and controlling powerful undead servants
key_abilities: Master of Minions: Control more powerful undead and maintain larger numbers
Undead Enhancement: Grant special abilities and increased power to undead servants
Corpse Explosion: Cause undead to explode violently when destroyed or commanded

skill_trees.name: Path of Life Manipulation
key_abilities: Vampiric Touch: Drain life with touch attacks that heal you proportionally
Life Tap: Convert your own health into mana in emergency situations
Soul Siphon: Drain spiritual energy to enhance magical abilities

skill_trees.name: Path of Dread
key_abilities: Aura of Fear: Emanate an aura that causes fear in nearby enemies
Curse of Weakness: Apply debilitating curses that weaken enemies over time
Doombringer: Mark targets for death, increasing all damage they receive

advancement_requirements.skill_points: At least 15 points in the Evocation Specialist skill tree
advancement_requirements.alignment: Must maintain Evil alignment for at least 10 levels
challenges: Successfully create and control multiple powerful undead simultaneously
Master the art of life drain and death magic

legendary_items.name: Staff of Undeath
effects: Intelligence increased by 5
Undead creation spells have 50% increased effectiveness
Can store the souls of defeated enemies to power necromantic spells

legendary_items.name: Phylactery Pendant
effects: Constitution increased by 3
If killed, automatically resurrect after 1 minute with 50% health
Lichform cooldown reduced by 2 days

legendary_items.name: Robes of the Grave
effects: Death Essence maximum increased by 50
Automatically drain life from nearby wounded enemies
Army of the Dead summons more powerful undead servants

everquest_inspired_abilities.name: Feign Death
everquest_inspired_abilities.description: Appear dead to enemies, dropping from their attention
mechanics: Instantly appear dead to all enemies, causing them to ignore you
Can be maintained indefinitely while motionless
Any movement or action breaks the effect
Provides opportunity to recover or reposition safely
Costs 25 Mana

everquest_inspired_abilities.name: Twisted Allure
everquest_inspired_abilities.description: Charm an undead creature to serve you temporarily
mechanics: Take control of an undead creature for up to 30 minutes
Controlled undead is more powerful than standard summoned minions
Can be maintained with periodic mana expenditure
If control is lost, the creature becomes hostile
Costs 50 Mana initially, 10 Mana per minute to maintain

everquest_inspired_abilities.name: Cascading Darkness
everquest_inspired_abilities.description: Apply multiple debilitating effects that stack over time
mechanics: Apply a sequence of debuffs that increase in potency over time
Effects include reduced armor, attack speed, movement, and healing received
Each effect lasts 2 minutes and can be refreshed
Maximum of 5 different effects can be active on a target
Costs 30 Mana per effect
everquest_inspired_abilities.cooldown: None, individual effects have 8 second casting time

everquest_inspired_abilities.name: Mana Tap
everquest_inspired_abilities.description: Drain mana from enemies to restore your own
mechanics: Drain up to 25% of target's current mana
Restore 150% of the amount drained to your own mana pool
Can be cast while moving
Particularly effective against spellcasting enemies
Costs 20 Mana

everquest_inspired_abilities.name: Dark Pact
mechanics: Convert up to 30% of current health into mana at a 1:2 ratio
Can be used even when silenced
Health sacrificed cannot be healed for 1 minute
Can be used to continue casting when mana is depleted
No mana cost

everquest_inspired_abilities.name: Animate Dead
everquest_inspired_abilities.description: Create a permanent undead servant from a corpse
mechanics: Transform a corpse into a permanent undead servant
Servant type depends on the corpse used (humanoid, beast, etc.)
Can have up to 3 permanent servants at once
Servants gain power as the necromancer levels up
Costs 100 Mana and 25 Death Essence

pet_system.description: Necromancers rely heavily on undead servants (pets) for both offense and utility

pet_types.name: Skeleton
pet_types.strengths: High physical resistance, good at holding aggro
pet_types.weaknesses: Vulnerable to holy damage, slow movement

pet_types.name: Ghoul
pet_types.weaknesses: Low defense, vulnerable to holy damage

pet_types.name: Wraith
pet_types.strengths: Can pass through obstacles, drain effects
pet_types.weaknesses: Low health, vulnerable to holy damage

pet_commands: Attack - Direct pet to attack a specific target
Guard - Pet remains stationary and attacks anything that approaches
Follow - Pet follows the necromancer without attacking
Stay - Pet remains in place until given another command
Special - Activates the pet's special ability
pet_system.pet_management: Necromancers must balance maintaining control over their pets with their own spellcasting. Pets drain mana while active, with more powerful pets requiring more maintenance.

dot_system.description: Necromancers excel at applying multiple damage-over-time (DoT) effects that stack and synergize

primary_dots.name: Poison Touch
primary_dots.effect: Deals poison damage every 3 seconds for 30 seconds

primary_dots.name: Wasting Disease
primary_dots.effect: Deals disease damage every 5 seconds for 45 seconds

primary_dots.name: Soul Rot
primary_dots.effect: Deals shadow damage every 3 seconds for 24 seconds
primary_dots.special: Each tick has a chance to restore mana to the caster

primary_dots.name: Cascading Doom
primary_dots.effect: Deals increasing shadow damage every 6 seconds for 36 seconds

dot_system.dot_synergies: When multiple DoTs are active on the same target, they create synergistic effects. For example, having both Poison Touch and Wasting Disease active increases the damage of both by 25%.

lore: Necromancers represent the darkest path an Evoker can take, having dedicated their magical prowess to mastering the energies of death and undeath. These morbid spellcasters have transcended ordinary evocation to become masters of life force manipulation and undead creation, capable of raising armies of the dead and draining the very essence of life from their enemies. The path to becoming a Necromancer requires not only exceptional magical talent and energy control but also a willingness to delve into forbidden knowledge and cross moral boundaries that most spellcasters would never approach. Those who succeed find themselves capable of commanding the dead and manipulating the boundary between life and death in ways that horrify conventional spellcasters. Necromancers typically operate from secluded lairs or ancient tombs, surrounded by their undead servants and macabre experiments. Many establish themselves as lords over small territories, using their undead minions to enforce their will and gather resources for their dark research. Some even become legendary figures whose mere mention causes fear and dread among common folk. Their combination of undead minions, life-draining abilities, and death magic makes them formidable opponents in any conflict, where their ability to replenish their forces from fallen enemies creates a steadily growing advantage as battles progress. Though they may lack the healing prowess of Channelers or the reality-bending capabilities of Eldritch practitioners, the minion control and self-sustainability of Necromancers make them perhaps the most relentless adversaries when attrition and sustained combat are factors.
